content.description: This is a fun route for beginners and novices as it has many variations at the start. Near vertical with large holds and good feet.  Start on the right side and climb the chimney or the left side for easier climbing. The easiest route up is mostly 5.5 or so with a 5.9 move near the top. This climb is in the shade all day.
content.protection: You can lead this with a couple of slings and a small piece for the crux. Theres a large boulder to sling at the top or belay off of the Bridwell bolt route anchors. You may want a directional for top roping.
content.location: This route is found on the left side of the face on billy goat rock. Start below the large cave and follow  the path of least resistance to the ramp at the finish. Walk off the back side or rap from anchors found on the right side of the face.

content.description:
This is the middle bolted route on Billy Goat Rock.

Climb up via easy but pumpy climbing to a bulge with garbage hands and non-existant feet above the second bolt. Continue on via pumpy pockets above to the top anchor, which is over the lip.
content.protection: No bolts left on this route, one 3 bolt anchor up top for far left route, almost too far left even for the unknown 5.8 route.

content.description: The right most route up the main face. It's the only route that still has bolts that haven't been chopped. Shares the same start as Permanent Erection. After about 8-10feet of climbing make a hard bouldery move right to a large black rock that looks out of place on the wall. After that climb just to the right of the Arete then pull move back left past the second bolt. Make a few move hard moves to the third and forth bolts. Don't be fooled about the top part of the route. From the ground it appears to be a give me, but it is a rather tricky sequence.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor just over the top lip. Be sure to bring longer slings if you plan on top roping any of the routes on this wall.
content.location: Right most route on the main face. Shares the start with Permanent Erection, then moves right after a few moves. Only completely bolted route on the wall. The walk off is directly off the back side down a tricky ramp.

content.description:
This is the leftmost bolted route on Billy Goat Rock.

Climb up using large holds for 2 bolts until a balancy section where a foot fell off, making this once 5.10c considerably harder than it's immediate neighbor Permanent Erection (5.11a). Once past this section large Castle Rocky pockets await as the route meets up with Permanent Erection.

The crux sits above an old rusty bolt (and only the second one up), so toproping is probably advisable.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor, which is over the lip of the rock.  To set up a toprope, bring a couple 6 foot slings, and walk up to the top of the rock and up over the top, and back down to the route.  Be careful downclimbing.

content.description: Start is just left of the 5.8 cave route. Hike up around to top of Billy Goat Rock, there is a 3 bolt anchor that you have to scoot/shimmy out to. Beginning of route is 5.6ish until about 10 feet up and then good hands and feet start to disappear. Last half of route is 5.10ish in my opinion. If anyone thinks the rating should be edited let me know! Also if anyone knows it by a different name!
content.protection: 3 bolt anchor at the top. A little PG getting to it and down climbing (back side of rock)
content.location: Start is left of the 5.8 cave route.
